contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=September 2011}} '''William Sheridan Allen''' (October 5, 1932 - March 14, 2013) was an American historian.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buffalonews.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?aid=/20130319/cityandregion/130319118/1101 |title=William S. Allen, retired UB history professor - City & Region |publisher=The Buffalo News |date=2013-03-19 |accessdate=2013-06-29}}</ref> ==Biography== Allen was born in [[Evanston, Illinois]], and studied at the universities of [[University of Michigan|Michigan]], [[University of Connecticut|Connecticut]], and [[University of Minnesota|Minnesota]], and in Germany at the [[Free University of Berlin]] and the [[University of Göttingen]]. ''The Nazi Seizure of Power'' (1965) was his first book. He also wrote ''The Infancy of Nazism'' and is at work on studies of the effectiveness of Nazi propaganda and of the [[Social Democratic]] underground in the [[Third Reich]]. He is now professor of history at the [[University at Buffalo, The State University of New York|State University of New York at Buffalo]]. Allen wrote two books on [[Adolf Hitler]] debunking the point of view that he came to power through violence. Rather, Allen claims, Hitler's [[Nazism|Nazi]] movement "seized power" in an act akin to democratic tactics. One of his books, ''[[The Nazi Seizure of Power: The Experience of a Single German Town 1922-1945]]'', was written to explain how one city, ([[Northeim, Germany]]) fell into the Nazi trap. Fed by Nazi propaganda, many people of Northeim, especially in the middle classes, in the midst of the [[Great Depression|Depression]] saw the Nazis as a way to get their country back to greatness that Hitler and the Nazis promised they would do. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{worldcat id|lccn-n83-233505}} *[http://www.history.buffalo.edu/people/facultyalpha.shtml University at Buffalo Official Website (lists "William Allen" as a professor emeritus, indicating that he is still living)] Retrieved 8/30/2011. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Allen, William Sheridan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American historian | DATE OF BIRTH = October 5, 1932 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = March 14, 2013 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Allen, William Sheridan}} [[Category:University of Michigan alumni]] [[Category:University of Connecticut alumni]] [[Category:University of Minnesota alumni]] [[Category:Free University of Berlin alumni]] [[Category:University of Göttingen alumni]] [[Category:University at Buffalo faculty]] [[Category:Historians of Nazism]] [[Category:1932 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:Historians of Germany]] [[Category:American historians]] {{US-nonfiction-writer-stub}} {{US-historian-stub}}
